extensionDescription.message: Switch the signature on/off or choose a new one from your predefined set.

optionsDefaultActionDescription.message: When opening a new compose window ...

optionsFortuneCookiesEditModalPlaceholde.message:
Chuck Norris can divide by zero.
%
Chuck Norris can kill two stones with one bird.
%
Chuck Norris once visited the Virgin Islands.
They are now The Islands.
%
Chuck Norris counted to infinity - three times.
%
Chuck Norris can slam a revolving door.

optionsFortuneCookiesRemoveModalQuestion.message: Do you really want to remove these fortune cookies?

optionsFortuneCookiesUsage1.message: create a new set of fortune cookies by clicking the button above

optionsFortuneCookiesUsage2.message: give the set a descriptive name

optionsFortuneCookiesUsage3.message: important: define a UNIQUE tag name!

optionsFortuneCookiesUsage4.message: click the text box to edit the cookies

optionsFortuneCookiesUsage5.message: use the tag name (enclosed by double square braces) in your signatures at the place where the random cookie should appear

optionsFortuneCookiesUsageExampleCode.message:
Moe Zilla
email: moe@zilla.org

Chuck Norris fact of the day:
[[chuck]]

optionsForwardingsNoDefaultAction.message: Don't apply default action when forwarding a mail.

optionsHelpSupport1.message: If you like this add-on and want to support the author, please visit

optionsHelpText.message: For detailed instructions or help, please check

optionsIdentitiesOverruleDefaultAction.message: Assigned signatures overrule the default action (insert/remove signature) when starting a new mail.

optionsIdentitiesSwitchSignatureUponChan.message: Automatically switch to assigned signature upon changing identity.

optionsIdentitiesTooltip.message: This list shows all mail-identities you've created in Thunderbird's native account settings.

optionsIdentitiesUseAssignedSignatureOnR.message: Use the assigned signature when starting a reply or forwarding.

optionsImageRemoveModalQuestion.message: Do you really want to remove this image?

optionsImageUsage1.message: create a new entry by clicking the button above

optionsImageUsage2.message: click the "Browse..." button to select and add an image file

optionsImageUsage3.message: give the image a descriptive name

optionsImageUsage4.message: important: define a UNIQUE tag name!

optionsImageUsage5.message: use the tag name (enclosed by double curly braces) in your HTML signatures together with the src attribute in an image element

optionsImageUsageNote.message: NOTE: Please handle the storage of image data here with care. Adding too many and/or too large images may degrade overall performance and waste storage space. Only use optimized assets really needed for signature creation.

optionsImportExportConfirmationModalQues.message: Do you really want to import the JSON data and overwrite all currently stored signatures?

optionsImportExportDataTooltip.message: JSON data in the form of:

optionsImportExportDescription1.message: This feature is primarily intended for backup/restore purposes. Export your signatures; copy them to the clipboard; paste into a text editor of your choice and save the data to a file. (Vice versa: Paste previously backed up data in here and import.)

optionsImportExportDescription2.message: NOTE: This export won't include the separately stored image data or 'Fortune Cookies' data; only signatures!

optionsRepliesNoDefaultAction.message: Don't apply default action when replying to a mail.

optionsSignatureEditModalAutoSwitchToolt.message: A comma separated list of email addresses, which - when detected as recipient - will automatically trigger insertion of this signature. (NOTE: The asterisk character can be used as wildcard.)

optionsSignatureEditModalContentTooltip.message: Depending on the mode used when composing an email (plaintext or HTML), the appropriate signature content will be used.

optionsSignatureEditModalNameTooltip.message: The name which gets displayed when selecting your signature via button or context menu.

optionsSignaturePlacementAboveQuoteOrFor.message: Place signature above reply-quote / forwarded message

optionsSignatureRemoveModalQuestion.message: Do you really want to remove this signature?

optionsSignatureSeparatorHtml.message: Automatically add signature separator ('-- \n') to HTML signatures.

signaturePlacementConfirmationModalQuest.message: It's not recommended to place an email-signature anywhere else but the very end of the complete message due to several reasons. Keep in mind that emails are being processed by a variety of different client-programs. Deviating from standards may not only limit functionality on your side but also impact the receiver's user experience. Do you really want to activate this option?

When placing signatures above the reply quote or a forwarded message, the "standard signature delimiter/separator" ('-- \n'; see: RFC 3676) will have to be omitted. This will make it harder/impossible to easily detect previously inserted signatures; which breaks other functionalities of this add-on (e.g. switching signatures when re-editing saved plaintext drafts, etc.). So... are you really sure you want to do this?

OK. Also, please be aware that any support/help from the author of this add-on will expire when this option is used. In order to accept this and finally activate the option, please press the keys listed below in correct sequence.
